Package nl.han.ica.yaeger.engine.entities.entity.sprites.delegates

Class SpriteAnimationDelegate

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.han.ica.yaeger.engine.entities.entity.sprites.delegates.SpriteAnimationDelegate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Updatable
    public class SpriteAnimationDelegate
extends java.lang.Object
implements Updatable
    A SpriteAnimationDelegate holds all responsibility related to Sprites that contain multiple images.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SpriteAnimationDelegate​(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView, int frames)
      Create a new SpriteAnimationDelegate for the given ImageView and number of frames.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void next()
      Set the next index of the sprite.
      void setAutoCycle​(long interval)
      Set the interval at which the sprite should be automatically cycled
      void setSpriteIndex​(int index)
      Set the index of the sprite.
      void update​(long timestamp)
      The update() method is called each frame.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpriteAnimationDelegate

        public SpriteAnimationDelegate​(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView,
                               int frames)
        Create a new SpriteAnimationDelegate for the given ImageView and number of frames. After construction, the spriteIndex will be set to the first frame.
        Parameters:
        imageView - The ImageView for which the different frames should be created
        frames - The number of frames available

    • Method Detail

      • setSpriteIndex

        public void setSpriteIndex​(int index)
        Set the index of the sprite. Since de modulus (mod frames) is used, this can be an unbounded integer.
        Parameters:
        index - The index to select. This index will be applied modulo the total number of frames

      • update

        public void update​(long timestamp)
        Description copied from interface: Updatable
        The update() method is called each frame.

        Use this method to init frame-based behaviour to the game-object.

        Specified by:
        update in interface Updatable
        Parameters:
        timestamp - the timestamp of the update

      • setAutoCycle

        public void setAutoCycle​(long interval)
        Set the interval at which the sprite should be automatically cycled
        Parameters:
        interval - the interval milli-seconds

      • next

        public void next()
        Set the next index of the sprite.
